intro: Cathartolinum virginianum, commonly known as the Virginia cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
